message: I need a small help. How can I restore an orphan git branch that was deleted remotely? Thanks

data.message: hmm.. the beginning point might be `git reflog`, then going by what you see in there. reflog is very strong utility

Random results from people that used git reflog for similar purpose: 
- http://blag.ahax.de/post/421939327/recovering-a-deleted-branch-using-git-reflog
- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4674226/does-github-keep-deleted-remote-branches-in-history-if-so-can-those-be-restore
- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5543280/how-do-i-get-the-deleted-branch-back-in-git
Already used it but it didn't help. to be more clear an Orphan branch doesn't have a parent that's the problem. you create a new branch with no history so I "guess" that's why reflog is not working
and all the commits in that branch only did not come up?

Yes, because an orphan branch has no parent commit so when you delete it apparently you delete all of it's history too & since it's doesn't point to any commits in the history of any branch you can't get it back.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/16506726/restoring-a-deleted-orphan-remote-branch-in-git/
As per your own post, someone who has the commits needs to do the reflog and restore the commits. Anyway, good luck.
